questions.question: What is the primary focus of still life art?
Which of the following is NOT a common texture type mentioned in the lecture notes?
What technique involves using dots to create texture?
Which technique is best suited for depicting organic textures?
What is the purpose of creating a focal point in a still life composition?
Which of the following is NOT an element of still life composition mentioned in the lecture notes?
What is the purpose of using negative space in a still life composition?
Which technique would be most appropriate for depicting the texture of tais fabric?
What is the primary purpose of lighting in a still life setup?
Which of the following is NOT a consideration when setting up a still life?
What is the definition of texture in art?
choices: The visual and tactile quality of a surface
questions.answer: The visual and tactile quality of a surface

questions.question: Which technique involves using parallel lines for uniform textures?
What is the purpose of using contrast in a still life composition?
choices: To make all objects appear the same

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of actual texture?
choices: A drawing of rough tree bark
A painting of a smooth vase
A digital image of a textured wall

questions.question: What is the primary difference between actual texture and visual texture?
choices: Actual texture is only visible, while visual texture is only tactile
Actual texture is physical, while visual texture is an illusion created by the artist
Actual texture is created by the artist, while visual texture occurs naturally
There is no difference between actual and visual texture
questions.answer: Actual texture is physical, while visual texture is an illusion created by the artist

questions.question: Which historical period saw a particular prominence in still life art?
What is the purpose of including objects with varying textures in a single still life composition?
choices: To make the drawing process easier
To create contrast and visual interest
To demonstrate the artist's collection of objects
questions.answer: To create contrast and visual interest

questions.question: Which technique would be most appropriate for depicting the smooth surface of a polished vase?
What is the purpose of the texture scavenger hunt activity mentioned in the resources?
choices: To collect objects for a still life
To practice identifying and sketching different textures
To create a texture reference sheet
questions.answer: To practice identifying and sketching different textures

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a suggested object for the still life drawing assignment?
What is the recommended size for the still life drawing assignment?
How many different texture techniques are students required to use in the still life drawing assignment?
What is the purpose of including a written reflection with the still life drawing assignment?
choices: To discuss object choices, challenges, and cultural significance
questions.answer: To discuss object choices, challenges, and cultural significance

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as an evaluation criterion for the still life drawing assignment?
choices: Accurate depiction of objects and their textures
Effective use of various texture techniques
Strong composition and use of light/shadow

questions.question: What is the purpose of the texture description writing exercise?
choices: To practice observing and describing textures without using obvious texture words
questions.answer: To practice observing and describing textures without using obvious texture words

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a common item in traditional still life compositions?
What is the primary purpose of arranging objects in a still life composition?
choices: To make the objects easier to draw
To create balance, harmony, and visual interest
To hide imperfections in individual objects
questions.answer: To create balance, harmony, and visual interest

questions.question: Which technique involves using thick layers of paint to create a three-dimensional, textured surface?
What is the purpose of studying local artists' work in the context of still life and texture?
choices: To understand cultural influences and techniques
questions.answer: To understand cultural influences and techniques

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a way that texture contributes to artwork?
